result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerad J Halverson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerad J Halverson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerad J Halverson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

Defendant Jerad J Halverson in court, in custody with attorney Stephen J. Meyer.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sentences defendant to: 13 CM 371 , Ct. 3, 9 month jail w/Huber consecutive to any other sentence, concurrent to Ct. 4 and 15 CF 218, Civil Judgment to be entered on any unpaid court obligations, Ct. 4, 9 months jail w/Huber, concurrent to Ct. 3 and 15 CF 218, any unpaid court obligations to be converted into civil judgment, 13 CM 592, Ct. 1, 9 months jail w/Huber, concurrent to 13 CM 371 and 15 CF 218, 96 days sentence credit, civil judgment to be entered on any unpaid court obligations, 15 CF 218, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1, 3 dismissed, Repeater Enhancer dismissed, 15 CF 218, Ct. 2, 90 days jail w/Huber, concurrent to 13 CM 371 and 13 CM 592

Defendant Jerad J Halverson in court, in custody.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is attempting to get an atty.  Defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Rights to court appointed atty discussed by court.  New preliminary hearing date set by court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
standard felony conditions, no possession/consumption of alcohol, not to upon premises that sells alcohol for onsight consumption/bar or tavern

Defendant Jerad J Halverson in court, in custody by video with attorney Margaret Andrea Waterman.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, no possession/consumption of alcohol, not go upon premises that sells alcohol for onsight consumption/bar or tavern, no time limit waiver,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
